events.name: US commitment to Taiwan's defense
events.wd_description: During his tour of Asia, President Biden stated that the US is prepared to defend Taiwan if China attacks, attracting remarks from the Chinese leadership.
events.description: During his tour of Asia, President Biden stated that the US is prepared to defend Taiwan if China attacks, attracting remarks from the Chinese leadership.

events.name: Biden's statement on Taiwan
events.wd_description: President Biden compared Taiwan's situation to the tensions between Russia and Ukraine and affirmed the US's commitment to defending Taiwan.
events.description: President Biden compared Taiwan's situation to the tensions between Russia and Ukraine and affirmed the US's commitment to defending Taiwan.

events.name: Chinese response
events.wd_description: The Chinese Foreign Minister reiterated that Taiwan is inseparable from China and urged the US to abide by the One-China Principle, stating that the situation in Ukraine is not comparable to Taiwan.
events.description: The Chinese Foreign Minister reiterated that Taiwan is inseparable from China and urged the US to abide by the One-China Principle, stating that the situation in Ukraine is not comparable to Taiwan.

events.name: US-Taiwan relations
events.wd_description: While the US acknowledges the One-China Principle, the Taiwan Relations Act mandates that the US must provide Taiwan with the means to defend itself.
events.description: While the US acknowledges the One-China Principle, the Taiwan Relations Act mandates that the US must provide Taiwan with the means to defend itself.

events.name: Andrey Melnichenko transfers ownership
events.wd_description: Russian businessman Andrey Melnichenko transferred ownership of two of the world's largest coal and fertilizer companies to his wife the day before he was sanctioned by the European Union.
events.description: Russian businessman Andrey Melnichenko transferred ownership of two of the world's largest coal and fertilizer companies to his wife the day before he was sanctioned by the European Union.

events.name: Ownership transfer details
events.wd_description: Legal filings show Melnichenko owned the companies through a chain of trusts and corporations from Moscow to Zug, Cyprus, and Bermuda. He made his wife the beneficiary upon his retirement.
events.description: Legal filings show Melnichenko owned the companies through a chain of trusts and corporations from Moscow to Zug, Cyprus, and Bermuda. He made his wife the beneficiary upon his retirement.

events.name: Sanction concerns
events.wd_description: Following Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Melnichenko was concerned about being sanctioned by the EU, leading to the transfer of ownership to his wife.
events.description: Following Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Melnichenko was concerned about being sanctioned by the EU, leading to the transfer of ownership to his wife.

events.name: Melnichenko's wealth
events.wd_description: Melnichenko, with an estimated fortune of $18 billion, was ranked as Russia's eighth richest man by Forbes last year.
events.description: Melnichenko, with an estimated fortune of $18 billion, was ranked as Russia's eighth richest man by Forbes last year.

events.name: China launches third aircraft carrier, June 2022
events.wd_label: China launches third aircraft carrier, June 2022
events.wd_description: China launched its third aircraft carrier, the "Fujian," the first to be wholly designed and built in the country, marking a significant advancement in its military capabilities.
events.description: China launched its third aircraft carrier, the "Fujian," the first to be wholly designed and built in the country, marking a significant advancement in its military capabilities.

events.name: Launch of the "Fujian" aircraft carrier
events.wd_description: The "Fujian," China's third and most advanced aircraft carrier, was launched at a Shanghai shipyard, featuring a catapult launcher system.
events.description: The "Fujian," China's third and most advanced aircraft carrier, was launched at a Shanghai shipyard, featuring a catapult launcher system.

events.name: Comparison with previous carriers
events.wd_description: The "Fujian" is more technically advanced than China's previous carriers, "Liaoning" and "Shandong," which use a ski-jump-style platform for launching aircraft.
events.description: The "Fujian" is more technically advanced than China's previous carriers, "Liaoning" and "Shandong," which use a ski-jump-style platform for launching aircraft.

events.name: Geopolitical implications
events.wd_description: The launch of the "Fujian" comes amid rising tensions between China and the US, with Chinese defense minister Wei Fenghe warning of potential conflict if Taiwan declares independence.
events.description: The launch of the "Fujian" comes amid rising tensions between China and the US, with Chinese defense minister Wei Fenghe warning of potential conflict if Taiwan declares independence.

events.name: Chinese EV battery material manufacturers scaling up production
events.wd_label: Chinese EV battery material manufacturers scaling up production
events.wd_description: China's top EV battery material manufacturers will invest at least 71 billion yuan to scale up output, with plans to triple production capacity in some products.
events.description: China's top EV battery material manufacturers will invest at least 71 billion yuan to scale up output, with plans to triple production capacity in some products.

events.name: Investment plans
events.wd_description: The planned investments cover all key components of lithium-ion batteries, with some companies not disclosing timelines or production expansion volumes.
events.description: The planned investments cover all key components of lithium-ion batteries, with some companies not disclosing timelines or production expansion volumes.

events.name: Market share growth
events.wd_description: Chinese suppliers have grown their market shares by driving down prices. Yunnan Energy New Material Group (Semcorp) aims to increase its global market share from 31% in 2021 to 50% in 2025.
events.description: Chinese suppliers have grown their market shares by driving down prices. Yunnan Energy New Material Group (Semcorp) aims to increase its global market share from 31% in 2021 to 50% in 2025.

events.name: Semcorp's expansion plans
events.wd_description: Semcorp plans to build factories in Yunnan, Jiangsu, Hubei, Chongqing, Hungary, and potentially North America, with an expected annual production capacity of 16 billion sq. meters by 2025.
events.description: Semcorp plans to build factories in Yunnan, Jiangsu, Hubei, Chongqing, Hungary, and potentially North America, with an expected annual production capacity of 16 billion sq. meters by 2025.

events.name: Customer base
events.wd_description: Semcorp's customers include Chinese EV battery makers CATL and BYD, as well as Japan's Panasonic and South Korea's Samsung and LG groups.
events.description: Semcorp's customers include Chinese EV battery makers CATL and BYD, as well as Japan's Panasonic and South Korea's Samsung and LG groups.

events.name: Revenue growth
events.wd_description: Semcorp reported an 86% jump in revenue last year to a record 7.9 billion yuan, aiming to raise non-Chinese customers' share of sales volume to 40% by 2025.
events.description: Semcorp reported an 86% jump in revenue last year to a record 7.9 billion yuan, aiming to raise non-Chinese customers' share of sales volume to 40% by 2025.

events.name: BTR New Material Group's expansion
events.wd_description: BTR New Material Group plans to nearly triple annual capacity to over 400,000 tons in the medium to long term, up from 140,000-plus tons at the end of 2021.
events.description: BTR New Material Group plans to nearly triple annual capacity to over 400,000 tons in the medium to long term, up from 140,000-plus tons at the end of 2021.

events.name: Jiangsu Guotai International Group's expansion
events.wd_description: Jiangsu Guotai International Group is building new plants in Zhejiang, Fujian, and Poland.
events.description: Jiangsu Guotai International Group is building new plants in Zhejiang, Fujian, and Poland.

events.name: Japanese competitors' market share decline
events.wd_description: Japanese companies once held an advantage in battery materials but lost their lead to Chinese competitors, with Chinese suppliers now holding global market shares ranging from 62% to 81%.
events.description: Japanese companies once held an advantage in battery materials but lost their lead to Chinese competitors, with Chinese suppliers now holding global market shares ranging from 62% to 81%.

events.name: Price competition and production readiness
events.wd_description: Chinese suppliers succeed through price competition and readiness to take on large orders, keeping costs down by buying vast supplies of materials.
events.description: Chinese suppliers succeed through price competition and readiness to take on large orders, keeping costs down by buying vast supplies of materials.

events.name: Government support
events.wd_description: Chinese government support has helped the industry grow, with Semcorp receiving over 100 million yuan of profit from state subsidies each year between 2019 and 2021.
events.description: Chinese government support has helped the industry grow, with Semcorp receiving over 100 million yuan of profit from state subsidies each year between 2019 and 2021.

events.name: Japanese competitors' strategies
events.wd_description: Japanese companies plan to expand production in the U.S. and Europe, focusing on higher-margin applications to avoid direct competition with Chinese suppliers.
events.description: Japanese companies plan to expand production in the U.S. and Europe, focusing on higher-margin applications to avoid direct competition with Chinese suppliers.

events.name: Concerns of supply glut
events.wd_description: China's rapid production expansion has fueled concerns of a supply glut, with predictions that production demand for some materials will far exceed global demand in 2025.
events.description: China's rapid production expansion has fueled concerns of a supply glut, with predictions that production demand for some materials will far exceed global demand in 2025.
